Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Preoperative Home-Based Exercise Training on Quality of Life After Lung Cancer Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: patients aged ≥18 years with confirmed or suspected lung malignancy (stage IIIA or lower) were randomised 1:1

Participants.evidence: patients aged ≥18 years with confirmed or suspected lung malignancy (stage IIIA or lower)

Intervention.evidence: PHET involved aerobic and resistance exercises with weekly telephone supervision

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial assessed the impact of preoperative home-based exercise training (PHET) on quality of life (QoL) following lung cancer surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was QoL, measured using the EORTC QLQ-C30 at baseline, pre-surgery, and 1 month post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated with allocation concealment in sealed envelopes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From September 2022 to May 2023, 46 patients were randomised (23 to each group).

Number_Analysed.evidence: Intention-to-treat analysis included 41 patients (20 PHET, 21 CG).

Result_Outcome.evidence: PHET demonstrated statistically and clinically significant improvements in global QoL before (mean difference [MD], 13.5; 95% CI, 2.4–24.6; p = 0.019) and after surgery (MD, 12.4; 95% CI, 1.3–23.4; p = 0.029).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were mild, with no serious events reported.
